intro: Cinchona longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered quinine tree, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white or pink flowers. The plant is notable for its medicinal properties, particularly the alkaloids found in its bark, which include quinine. It typically grows as a tall shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a distinct aromatic scent.
